forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Drizzle after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 47, with temperatures rising to around 49 overnight. South southwest wind 5 to 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Drizzle before 10am, then rain. Cloudy. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 9 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The evening air envelops Downtown San Francisco as it prepares for an embrace from a steady drizzle. A veil of clouds hangs low, shrouding the skyline in a muted palette, only hinting at the vibrant city beneath. At a brisk 47 degrees and rising ever so slightly, the night holds a chill that nudges inhabitants to layer up—perhaps a cozy sweater under a waterproof jacket would suffice against the moisture that feels imminent. 

Tomorrow heralds a full-on deluge, with drizzle giving way to rain by mid-morning. The brisk winds from the south will add an element of intensity, whipping through the streets and urging pedestrians to keep light feet and warm hearts. With a certainty of precipitation lurking at every turn, one might consider a leisurely morning spent indoors; perhaps finding solace in the pages of a good book at a nearby café or indulging in the culinary delights of a local bistro. Embrace the cool fog and the rhythm of the falling rain—there is a tranquil beauty even in the most unremarkable of days.
